title: How to Make a Cake from a Mix Without Oil and Eggs

steps.title: Prepare the pan and preheat the oven.
steps.content: Prepare the pan and preheat the oven. Grease and flour a 9” by 13” pan by spraying some nonstick spray (like Pam) on the bottom and all four sides of the pan [2] X Research source and then sprinkling a light coat of flour on top. Preheat your oven as directed on the cake mix box, usually to 350 degrees. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl.
steps.content: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl. Get a medium sized mixing bowl and pour the contents of the cake mix into it.

steps.title: Add the other ingredients.
steps.content: Add the other ingredients. Pour into the mixing bowl the other ingredients and stir it in with the cake mix. Add the vinegar, vanilla, and applesauce and mix the ingredients together. Basically, one cup of applesauce per box of cake mix acts as a fair substitute for the required amount of eggs and oil. In a typical cake (if you were making this without the box), one cup of applesauce replaces the two eggs usually asked for.

steps.title: Add the water.
steps.content: Add the water. Pour the water into the mixing bowl and stir it into the batter. Use a whisk to make sure you smooth out any lumps that might form and keep stirring until all of the ingredients are mixed together into one consistent mixture.

steps.title: Pour the batter into your prepared pan.
steps.content: Pour the batter into your prepared pan. Don't forget to smooth out the surface of the batter using a flat knife or the back of a spoon. Note: Be careful not to splash any of the batter on the edges of the pan; these pieces will burn and become inedible.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Look at the baking directions on the cake mix box and follow them. You will probably bake it for 30 to 40 minutes. Make sure you check on the cake periodically to ensure that it's not being baked for too long.

steps.title: Let the cake cool before serving.
steps.content: Let the cake cool before serving. Remove the cake from the oven and allow it to stand on the counter for 15 to 30 minutes before serving. Otherwise, it may be too hot for you to eat. Note: You can also add frosting to the cake, but remember that this will add extra sugar and calories.

steps.title: Prepare your pan and preheat the oven.
steps.content: Prepare your pan and preheat the oven. Grease and flour a 9” by 13” pan by spraying some nonstick spray (like Pam) on the bottom and all four sides of the pan [4] X Research source and then sprinkling a light coat of flour on top. Preheat your oven as directed on the cake mix box, usually to 350 degrees. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl.
steps.content: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl. Get a medium sized mixing bowl and pour the contents of the cake mix into it.

steps.title: Add the soda.
steps.content: Add the soda. Pour the can of cream soda into the cake mix until the batter is well blended and there are no lumps in the mixture. [6] X Research source Note: Do not add any water, just the cream soda. You can also use diet cream soda to reduce the number of calories in this dish.

steps.title: Pour the cake batter into your cake pan.
steps.content: Pour the cake batter into your cake pan. Pour all of the cake batter into the pan you prepared, being careful to keep the sides of the pan free of excess batter.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Following the direction on the cake mix box, bake the cake as directed (usually 30 minutes). Remove the cake and let it stand for at least 15 minutes before serving.

steps.title: Preheat your oven.
steps.content: Preheat your oven. According to the directions on the cake mix box, preheat your oven. The box will usually call for preheating the oven to about 350 degrees.

steps.title: Grease your pan and sprinkle it with flour.
steps.content: Grease your pan and sprinkle it with flour. Use a nonstick spray like Pam to grease your pan. Spray a light layer on the bottom and all four sides, making sure that there is an even coating. Once the pan is greased, sprinkle about 1 tablespoon of flour in the pan. Gently shake the flour around the pan until the bottom and the sides of the pan are coated with the flour.

steps.title: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl.Get a medium sized mixing bowl and pour the contents of the cake mix into it.
steps.content: Pour the cake mix into a mixing bowl.Get a medium sized mixing bowl and pour the contents of the cake mix into it.

steps.title: Add the can of pumpkin puree.
steps.content: Add the can of pumpkin puree. Pour the pumpkin puree into the mixing bowl and stir it together with the cake mix. Make sure to get out all of the lumps so that you have a smooth, clump-free batter. Note: The pumpkin puree works best with a white or a yellow cake mix. [7] X Research source The flavor of the pumpkin will be diminished if you use a chocolate or other strong-flavored cake mix

steps.title: Add the water and mix.
steps.content: Add the water and mix. Pour in the water and mix it with the pumpkin puree and the cake mix until the mixture is well blended.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Pour the mixture into your cake pan and put it in the oven. Bake the cake as directed on the box, usually about 30 minutes.

steps.title: Let the cake cool.
steps.content: Let the cake cool. Make sure you let the cake stand for at least 15 minutes once you are done baking it. This will give the cake plenty of time to cool down before you try to eat it.
